Detailed Description

A modular functionality which can be applied to the framework.

Features are options to the whole project build, which may also have impact to more than one component like driver, protocol stack, APOXI, MMI, applications. Additionally features can control the build process, as they are processed in various makefiles.


Naming conventions and usage instructions:

  • Feature strings do not contain any APOXI pre-/in-/postfix, but must contain the prefix FEAT_. The syntax therefore is: FEAT_<feature>, where <feature> is the name of the corresponding feature.
  • Feature names must be clear and unambiguous.
  • Alternative or group features must be documented in a common prefix (e.g. FEAT_AFSFFS, FEAT_AFSMMC).
  • If a feature is spanning over more than one component (RefMMI, APOXI, protocol stack, ...) and impacts APOXI, then in must be documented in the file apoxi.features.
  • All features used in APOXI must be documented and regularly updated in the file apoxi.features.
  • Before a feature is allowed to be used it must be announced via UTP ticket against the product CBE_KEYWORDVALUES. After confirmation of the feature name by CBE CCB the feature is ready to use for APOXI. (A detailed process description can be found in http://goto.infineon.com/CN-intranet-public/Develop_Environment/Common_Build_Environment/SW_Instruction_Comp_Define_01_00.doc)

Define Documentation

#define ADDITIONAL_THEMES
 

Adds the themes 'Foggy Theme' and 'Customizable Theme'.

Adds the themes 'Foggy Theme' and 'Customizable Theme' to the already available 'Default Theme'.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_ADDITIONAL_THEMES_SUPPORT

#define AFSFAT
 

APOXI filesystem AFSFAT

Detailed description Activates the FAT filesystem. This activation has to be done for supporting FAT devices like MMC or NAND.

On host the FAT devices have to be activated seperately. On target the recognized FAT devices will register them on their own.


Feature dependencies:

  • FAT_FS

#define AFSFFS
 

APOXI FlashFileSystem

Detailed description Activates the Apoxi FlashFileSystem, which is the default filesystem, where currently all configuration files (e.g. for Aragon) are saved.


Feature dependencies:

  • FFS

#define AFSRAM
 

APOXI file system AFSRAM

Detailed description Activates the Apoxi RAM file system which stores data in a virtual directory hierarchy in memory.

#define AFSRFS
 

APOXI RootFileSystem

Detailed description Activates the abstract RootFileSystem. The RootFileSystem is a default interface to access all Apoxi filesystems. It coordinates the access to the concrete implementations (e.g. FlashFileSystem, FAT filesystem).

The concrete filesystem implementations (e.g. FlashFileSystem) can be used without the Rootfilesystem too, but it is recommended to use the abstract class for all filesystem accesses.

#define ARAGON
 

ARAGON is used to build a phone MMI with the ARAGON IDE on a host computer.

ARAGON is an APOXI feature that can be used to define a phone's complete MMI via configuration files built with the ARAGON IDE. The resulting configuration files are read from the FFS.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_ARAGON_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • ADDITIONAL_THEMES As Aragon is also used to read customized themes from configuration files, the feature ADDITIONAL_THEMES must also be enabled so that the CustomizableTheme is built.

#define AT_MMI_INTERWORKING
 

Interworking between APOXI and other stack-clients.

If APOXI is not the only client for the stack it is necessary to have some interworking with other clients. Normaly ATC is the second client which is the the case if bluetooth is activated. In this case this feature activates the interworking.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_CALL
  • APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_SIMTK
  • APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_SS
  • APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_USSD

#define ATI
 

The feature ATI mainly covers the new generic companion interface (GCI) adressing video codecs, audio codecs and graphics device driver interfaces for ATI W2x82 companion

This GCI driver is available for target and for a special ALIHOST environment. In this special ALIHOST configuration the PC is extended by a PCI card from ATI with an companion daughter board, LCD panel and camera. This "ALIHOST PCI" build uses a GCI driver for WIN32 OS. For this purpose the corresponding threads have to be started at system startup for ALIHOST. This is the main impact on APOXI. In case of target SW, GCI runs in NucleusPlus threads to adress ATI W2x82 companion.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_ATI_SUPPORT=yes APOXI_DEFS += \ APOXI_ATI_SUPPORT \ APOXI_GDD_INTERFACE \ APOXI_GDD_2_0_INTERFACE \ APOXI_ATIW2282_SUPPORT ifeq '${TARGETSYSTEM}' 'HW' APOXI_DEFS += ATI_CONFIG_TARGET_VENUS_HW endif ifeq '${TARGETSYSTEM}' 'ALIHOST' APOXI_DEFS += ALIHOST_ATI_PCI endif


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define ATL
 

ATL - Application Template Library

ATL provides a framework on top of APOXI that allows easy customization of the menu structure, of context dependent key behaviour and softkey assignments.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_ATL_SUPPORT

#define CAMERA
 

Enables the support for the still camera and video camera device.

Enables the support for the still camera and video camera device. If the support is enabled, the CameraConfig must be available, which also instantiates the devices for camera and video.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_CAMERA_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define CODEC_MAN
 

Allows to use codec manager for MMFr

Codec manager administrates video and audio codecs (decoders and encoders) in Apoxi. It provides methods to access a specific de-/encoder. It is used by Multimedia Framework (MMFr).


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_CODEC_MAN_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define DEBUG_INFO
 

Activate debug trace output and crash debug output

This feature enables the APOXI trace debug outputs (done via DBG_OUT macro) and additionally activates various crash recovery information, like memory check, stacksize checks ...

Attention: When activating this feature trace outputs are added without respect to the buildmode environment variable ${BUILDMODE}. That means if a build is done with ${BUILDMODE}=RELEASE and this feature is enabled, the trace debug outputs are still part of the build. This has a special focus with codesize reduction issues.


Activated defines:

  • _DEBUG
  • APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ACCESS_CHECK
  • APOXI_ENABLE_STACK_CHECK

#define DRM
 

Allows protection of content using digital rights technology (incl. aes, xmlparser, wbxml)

Detailed description Stores & manages the digital rights in the mobile for protection of content (e.g., wallpapers, screensavers, ringtones, etc) obtained from a content provider's URL. There are 3 mechanisms in DRM V1.0: Forward lock - Content is not allowed to be forwarded (i.e., using local connectivity, MMS, etc) by the user & default max rights is appled to the content (e.g., a very high count of using the content & a large validity period of usage) Combined delivery - The content & digital rights are bundled in one downloaded message Separate delivery - The content is obtained first & the rights arrive later via a WAP Push message

The content file has an additional attribute 'DRM bit' to indicate that it's a DRM-protected object. The applications, e.g., ImageBrowser & SoundBrowser, check this attribute for any content file & invoke the DRM module to take care of the applicable rights.

DRM uses the AES module internally to decrypt the separate delivery content file. The WbxmlParser is used to parse the rights (in binary XML format) pertaining to the separate delivery content. The XmlParser is used to parse the rights (in plain text XML format) embedded within the combined delivery object.


Activated defines: APOXI_INCLUDE_DRM APOXI_LIB_ADDON_AES APOXI_LIB_ADDON_DRM APOXI_LIB_ADDON_WBXML APOXI_LIB_ADDON_XMLPARSER


Feature dependencies: AFSFFS

#define DUAL_DISPLAY
 

Enables dual display support for the default DisplayConfig class.

Enables dual display support for the default DisplayConfig class, so that the customization for dual display support is more easy. The define itself is not used by APOXI itself and only meant for allow to turn on the feature DUAL_DISPLAY without touching the class DisplayConfig.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_DUAL_DISPLAY_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define EMZ_CODECS
 

Allows to use SW audio and video codecs from Emuzed

Allows to use Software audio and video codecs (decoders and encoders) from Emuzed. They are accessible via codec manager.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_EMZ_CODECS_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • CODEC_MAN is mandatory in order to access the SW codecs from Emuzed.

#define EXTERNAL_RINGER
 

Enable the YAMAHA player support

APOXI support for MIDI, SMAF on YAMAHA MXx IC


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_YAMAHA_RINGER_SUPPORT

#define FAT_FS
 

Activates FAT file system support on driver layer

Detailed description Activates the FAT filesystem support on driver layer. For Apoxi a seperate feature define "AFSFAT" has to be defined.

#define FEAT_BT_A2DP
 

Activate Bluetooth Advanced Audio Distribution Profile

A2DP is a Bluetooth profile that allows the sending of high quality audio data to a remote device (Sink). This feature enables functionality in APOXI Bluetooth, APOXI Audio and the BTAPI stack.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_LIB_FEAT_BT_A2DP


Feature dependencies:

  • BLUETOOTH mandatory

#define FEAT_BT_AVRCP
 

Activate Bluetooth Audio Video Remote Control Profile

AVRCP is used to implement Audio/Video Remote control functionality. Two roles can be implemented - the controller role, which enables the mobile phone user to control other AVRCP enabled devices (play, stop, fast forward, etc.) and the target role, which allows the user to control media applications implemented in the phone to be controlled by AVRCP controller.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_LIB_BT_AVRCP


Feature dependencies:

  • BLUETOOTH mandatory

#define FEAT_BT_BIP
 

Bluetooth Basic Imaging Profile

This feature enables APOXI Bluetooth BIP. Currently BT BIP Image Push and Image Pull in initiator and responder role are supported.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_LIB_BLUETOOTH_BIP


Feature dependencies:

  • BLUETOOTH mandatory

#define FEAT_BT_BPP
 

Bluetooth Basic Printing Profile

Detailed description Bluetooth: Basic Printing Profile (sender role) to connect to another BPP device (printer role) to print out. In Apoxi only the sender role of BPP is implemented. The following objects are printable, well formatted (printer device dependent): XHTML, VCARD, VCALENDER, JPEG, GIF, etc...


Activated defines:

  • FEAT_BT_BPP
  • APOXI_LIB_FEAT_BT_BPP


Feature dependencies:

  • BLUETOOTH

#define FEAT_BTSOCKET
 

Bluetooth specific address class

This gives the Bluetooth (RFCOMM and L2CAP) specific address implementations.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_LIB_ADDON_BTSOCKET

#define FEAT_EXTERNAL_PCH_CONTROL
 

External PCH Control

This feature enables the monitoring and control of external GPRS data connections (used via AT terminals). If the feature is activated the MMI can listen to the ExternalPdpContextInfoMsg message to be informed when the user sets up or terminates a GPRS data connection via AT. Furthermore it is also possible to force the termination of an external GPRS data connection via MMI.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_EXTERNAL_PCH_CONTROL_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define FEAT_FOTA
 

Firmware update Over The Air

This feature enables Firmware update over the air in APOXI. For detailed description see class Fota.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_FOTA_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define FEAT_MMCALL
 

Multimedia Call Handling API

This feature enables APOXI Multimedia Call Hanlding. It provides an interface equivalent to the Voice Call Handling for setting up a MM MOC, accepting or rejecting a MM MTC, for releasing a MM call and provides access to the data stored in the CallHandlingData object of MainHandler.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_LIB_ADDON_MMCALL

#define FEAT_SECURECLOCK
 

Secure Clock

Enables additional interfaces in class RealTimeClock to access secure clock information. See RealTimeClock::GetSecureDateTime and RealTimeClock::IsSecureClockValid.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_SECURECLOCK_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies: N/A

#define FEAT_SERIALSOCKET
 

Generic Serial Socket Interface

This feature gives the apoxi serial socket interface to communicate with different underlying transport protocals like RFCOMM, L2CAP, etc.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_LIB_ADDON_SERIALSOCKET

#define FEAT_SIOSOCKETADAPTER
 

Define for Low Level SIO Sockets access over Serial Sockets

Detailed description Enable this define, if Low Level SIO Sockets access over Serial Sockets are needed.


Activated defines:

  • #
  • #


Feature dependencies:

  • FEAT_SERIALSOCKET

#define FFS
 

Activates flash file system (FFS) on driver layer

Activates the Apoxi FlashFileSystem on driver layer. The FFS is the default filesystem, where currently all configuration files (e.g. for Aragon) are saved. The corresponding define to activate the Apoxi support for the FlashFileSystem is "AFSFFS".

#define FMRADIO
 

FM radio support

Support of the FM Radio device including capabilities such as station search or RDS


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_FM_RADIO_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define FTPSERVER
 

Allows to create, start and use an FTP server in APOXI.

Implementation of the Server interface for the file transfer protocol (as specified in RFC 959). It creates a home directory in AFSFFS (or AFSRAM if available).


Feature dependencies:

  • AFSFFS is needed to create the home directory of the FTP server in FFS (if AFSRAM is not available).
  • AFSRAM is optional if the home directory of the server should be located in the virtual RAM drive (otherwise in FFS).
  • AFSRFS is needed as the FtpServer must have access to the files in the root file system.
  • SERVER is mandatory as FtpServer is a implementation of the generic Server interface.

#define GDD
 

use graphics device driver (GDD)

Feature, which enables support for GDD. Usually this feature is always set and must not be unset, unless an own driver I/F for display and camera is used


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_GDD_INTERFACE


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define GTL
 

GTL

This feature enables GTL support. In combination with feature GTL_EBU and GTL_DIF, it allows to select the type of display interface, either serial or parallel.


Activated defines:

  • N/A


Feature dependencies:

  • GTL_EBU
  • GTL_DIF

#define HTTPSERVER
 

Allows to create, start and use an HTTP server in APOXI.

Implementation of the Server interface for the hypertext transfer protocol (as specified in RFC 2616). It creates a home directory in AFSFFS, where files can be stored (e.g. via FtpServer or PhoneTool) for public access. Additionally the index page of the server shows a list of available web applications including a brief description.


Feature dependencies:

  • AFSFFS is needed to create the home directory of the FTP server in FFS (if AFSRAM is not available).
  • AFSRFS is needed as the HttpServer must have access to files (e.g. style sheets, images) in the root file system.
  • SERVER is mandatory as HttpServer is a implementation of the generic Server interface.

#define HTTPWAPINTERFACE
 

HTTP/WAP and profile management interface

Detailed description HTTP/WAP and profile management interface that 3rd party WAP s/w has to adhere to.


Activated defines: APOXI_LIB_ADDON_HTTPWAPINTERFACE \ APOXI_WAP_STACK


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define INTERNATIONALIZATION
 

Allows to use factory customized packs for languages and T9 dictionaries.

Allows to use factory customized packs for languages and T9 dictionaries.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_FACTORY_CUSTOMIZATION_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define IRDA
 

IrDA (in case of combination with OBEX, the IrDA/Obex transport is also activated

IrDA utilizes the infra red devices onboard. It is used for modem functionality and can also serve as transport layer for OBEX. In case of presence of OBEX, the IrDA/Obex transport layer also gets compiled into a separate library. APP_IRDA is not an APOXI define, but an coexisting MMI define, to include an application, which takes over the IrDA-hardware on/off switching.


Activated defines:

  • FEATURE+=IRDA
  • APPLICATIONS+=APP_IRDA


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define LCS
 

location based services using AGPS technology

Detailed description Location Services (LCS) module offers API to develop powerful location based services applications. The following functionality is currently supported:

  • Self-location -> User can obtain his location
  • Transfer-location -> User can transfer his location to a specified Lcs client
  • MT-LR -> User is notified in case someone is trying to locate him & is prompted for approval
  • NMEA data transfer -> User's location information is converted to NMEA format & transmitted via a serial cable to say, another device or a PC

AGPS technology is used to fulfil the above functionality. The required protocol handling is done either via GLTP (proprietary Global Locate protocol) or 3GPP procedures. The user can also choose stand-alone mode wherein AGPS is switched to conventional GPS without establishing a connection to the n/w.


Activated defines: LCS_3GPP LCS_GLTP LCS_STAND_ALONE LCS_LANDMARK APOXI_LIB_ADDON_LCS


Feature dependencies: GPS SOCKET AFSFFS

#define MENU_ACCESSORS
 

Obsolete feature, which enables menu accessor support for GUI.

Obsolete feature, which enables the menu accessor support for GUI. Menu accessors have been replaced by the item concept since APOXI and Reference MMI 2.0. It is planned that this feature will be removed in APOXI-3.0, as it is not used by any customer yet.


Activated defines:

  • N/A


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define MM_CHIP_SCICOS
 

Support for SciCOS companion chip

Enables the transparent mode of SciCOS (in a platform supporting the SciCOS companion chip). The SciCOS chip is disabled and only the path to the LCD is switched.


Activated defines:

  • N/A


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define MMCI
 

Activates multi media card (MMC) on egold, sgold, or sgold2

Detailed description This feature activates the multi media card (MMC) support on driver layer. For Apoxi no additional define is needed, because the different FAT devices (MMC is one of those) register themselves automatically. The only precondition is that the FAT filesystem is activated. This happens by two feature defines AFSFAT (Apoxi layer) and FAT_FS (driver layer)


Feature dependencies:

  • FAT_FS
  • AFSFAT

#define MP3
 

MP3 support having codec available in the firmware

This feature should be enabled whenever the FW provides MP3 codec. This feature should not be defined when the decoding is done in MMFr (ex. MPE)


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_MP3_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define MULTIMEDIA
 

Multimedia addons (incl. libpng & zlib)

This feature enables multimedia support for APOXI including Jpeg en/decoding, GIF, PNG, BMP and WBMP decoding.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_MULTIMEDIA_SUPPORT
  • APOXI_VIDEO_SUPPORT
  • APOXI_ENABLE_ALPHA_BLENDING
  • APOXI_ENABLE_ANIMATED_TITLE
  • APOXI_ENABLE_ARC_DRAWING
  • APOXI_ENABLE_CIRCLE_DRAWING
  • APOXI_ENABLE_DIAGONAL_LINE_DRAWING
  • APOXI_ENABLE_POLYGON_DRAWING

#define OBEX
 

OBEX - OBject EXchange protocol support

Detailed description

This feature enables a multi-transport OBEX interface which supports both client- and server applications. Furthermore the OPP (Object Push Profile) profile is implemented based on plain OBEX. At least one implementation of the internal transport interface (called Transport Adapter) must be available as well (pls. see list below).


Activated defines:

  • N/A


Feature dependencies:

  • IRDA optional
  • BLUETOOTH optional
  • USB optional

#define OBEXFTP_RFS
 

Obex-FTP server for APOXI Root File System (RFS)

This feature enables the Obex-FTP server implemenation for the APOXI Root File System (RFS). This ready-to-use server implemenation may be used by an application to provide the user an Obex-FTP server to gain access to the RFS through all available transport layers like Bluetooth, IRDA, USB, etc.


Feature dependencies:

  • OBEX mandatory
  • AFSRFS mandatory

#define PNG_ENCODER
 

Enables PNG encoder

This feature enables PNG encoder support for APOXI.


Feature dependencies:

  • MULTIMEDIA mandatory


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_PNG_ENCODER_SUPPORT

#define SDMMCSPI
 

Activates multi media card (MMC) and SD-card on sgoldlite

Detailed description This feature activates the multi media card (MMC) support on driver layer. For Apoxi no additional define is needed, because the different FAT devices (MMC is one of those) register themselves automatically. The only precondition is that the FAT filesystem is activated. This happens by two feature defines AFSFAT (Apoxi layer) and FAT_FS (driver layer).


Feature dependencies:

  • FAT_FS
  • AFSFAT

#define SERVER
 

Generic server interface.

Abstract interface for TCP based servers.

#define SIMTK_LETTERCLASS_E
 

SIM Toolkit Letter Class E

Detailed description SIM Toolit Letter Class E defines access of SIM applications to internet resources using TCP or UDP sockets. The user should be asked / informed about outgoing transaction operations.


Activated defines:

  • SIMTK_LETTERCLASS_E
  • APOXI_LETTERCLASSE_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define SVG
 

Enables support for SVG

Enables support for scalable vector graphics.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_SVG_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • MULTIMEDIA mandatory

#define T9
 

Predictive input T9

Enables the support for predictive input method T9.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_T9_SUPPORT

#define TESTING
 

Enabling APOXI Tester instrumentations

This features activated the instrumentations for automated testing using APOXI Tester.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_TESTING


Feature dependencies:

  • DEBUG must be activate

#define TTY
 

TTY, TeleTYpewriter

For dumb and deaf people it is not possible to use common phones. With a additional device to the phone it is possible to visualize speech on a screen and typed text is translated to speech. This must be supported by the provider because the translation from speech to text and vice versa must be done there. With this feature the support for TTY is activated in APOXI.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_CTM

#define UNITTEST
 

Unittest Framework

This featuer enables the APXOI Unittest framework


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_UNITTEST
  • APOXI_UNITTEST_TCPIP if feature SOCKET is activated
  • APOXI_UNITTEST_NO_MESSAGE if feature DEBUG_INFO is not activated
  • APOXI_UNITTEST_NO_FILENAMES if feature DEBUG_INFO is not activated


Feature dependencies:

  • SOCKET activates the remote TCPIP unit-testing functionality
  • DEBUG_INFO adds unittest extended debug output

#define UUS
 

User-to-User Signaling (UUS)

Enables User-to-User Signaling in APOXI. Currently only UUS1 implicit is supported.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_UUS_SUPPORT

#define VIB
 

Vibrator support

Detailed description


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_VIBRATOR_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define VOICERECOGNITION
 

Voice Recognition

Enables the Voice Recognition interface in APOXI. Currently there is no VR support in stack/driver layer, so the APOXI interfaces are not yet thoroughly tested.

#define YAMAHA_MAPI
 

Yamaha Mapi

The Yamaha MA3 and MA5 chips can be controlled directly through the Yamaha Music API (a set of C-functions wrapping the lower-level Yamaha sound middleware) if you enable this feature.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_YAMAHA_MAPI_SUPPORT


Feature dependencies:

  • N/A

#define ZI8
 

Predictive input ZI8

APOXI support for Zi8 predictive input.


Activated defines:

  • APOXI_ZI8_SUPPORT
